intro: Brunellia cuzcoensis, commonly known as the Cuzco bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, broad-leaved foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
